Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands a broad-shouldered man, his mask painted with the ashen swirl of ancient fires. His cloak smells faintly of woodsmoke and wild herbs.

"Stranger, you walk the sacred ground of the Verdant Tribes. I am Kaelor the Ash-Walker, chieftain and protector. Speak your purpose, but know that trust is hard-won among our people."

Option.text: I wish to prove myself to your tribe.
Tell me about the Verdant Tribes.
What do you know of Hinokami?
Do you fear Minax?
Tell me about your past, Chieftain.
I mean no harm. I will leave you in peace.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor’s eyes narrow, measuring you with a warrior’s gaze.

"Words are wind. Only action earns trust here. Prove your worth—hunt the Shadowfang, a beast corrupted by Minax that stalks our groves. Or, aid my people by forging bonds with Hinokami; peace is the sharpest arrow in our quiver."

Option.text: Tell me about the Shadowfang hunt.
How could I help with Hinokami?
I’ll return when I am ready.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The Verdant Tribes have walked these woods long before the high towers of Britain or the cherry blossoms of Hinokami. We are children of spirit and soil, guided by the wisdom of shamans and the courage of hunters. Outsiders see us as wild. Let them—we know who we are."

Option.text: What dangers do your people face?
How do you lead your tribe?
I want to prove myself.
Thank you for sharing. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Danger comes as beast, blade, and dark magic. Minax sends her cultists to sow fear. Hinokami presses at our borders, ever hungry for new land. Even the wilds themselves twist against us since Lord British vanished."

Option.text: How can I help?
I understand. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText: "A chieftain leads with the wisdom of the council and the strength of the hunt. I do not rule by fear, but by respect earned in fire and storm. My people challenge me—so must you, if you seek a place among us."

Option.text: Set me a challenge, then.
Your tribe is strong indeed. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Hinokami’s folk are disciplined, clever, and proud. They speak of honor, but their swords cut as deep as any. I respect their skill, but we quarrel over land that our ancestors once walked together. Still, I do not wish needless war while Minax grows in the shadows."

Option.text: Could there be peace with Hinokami?
Do you want me to mediate?
I prefer to hunt, not parley.
Thank you for your honesty. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor sighs, his posture softening.

"Perhaps. Some among my tribe—and theirs—believe in peace. Speak with Shaman Nura, if you would walk the path of diplomacy. Or, bring me a token of Hinokami’s trust, and I will know you are true."

Option.text: I will speak to Shaman Nura.
Option.action: SendMessage:Seek out Nura in the spirit grove.

Option.text: What kind of token would prove trust?
I am better suited to the hunt.
I will consider your words.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The Lantern of Peace—a sacred lantern from Hinokami’s shrine. If you can persuade their monks to share it, or win it in honest contest, I will see you as a true bridge between our peoples. But know: theft would bring only shame and fury."

Option.text: I accept this quest for peace.
That is a heavy burden. I will try.
No, the hunt is my calling.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Bring the Lantern to me without bloodshed, and you will earn the trust of both tribes. Go in peace, and may the spirits guide you."

Option.text: I will return with the Lantern of Peace.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Peace is a path as treacherous as any hunt. My rival, Shogun Ryuji, respects only those who prove their honor. Carry my challenge to him, or bring back a token of their goodwill. Choose your path, but do not betray the trust of either tribe."

Option.text: I will carry your challenge to Shogun Ryuji.
I will look for another way.
This is not my fight.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Take this scroll to Hinokami’s camp and deliver my words to Ryuji. Honor demands an answer. Return with his reply, and you shall have my respect."

Option.text: I accept.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor’s grip tightens on his club.

"The Shadowfang is no mere beast—it is Minax’s taint made flesh. Hunt it in the Cursed Grove to the north. Bring me its fanged heart as proof, and you will walk as a hunter among us."

Option.text: I will hunt the Shadowfang.
Where can I find the Cursed Grove?
Perhaps I am not ready yet.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The Cursed Grove lies past the spirit stones, where the shadows grow long and silence hangs heavy. Tread carefully—Minax’s magic twists more than beasts there."

Option.text: I will hunt the Shadowfang.
I will wait until I am ready.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Return with the Shadowfang’s heart, and you shall have my respect. Go, and let your spirit burn brighter than the ash."

Option.text: I will not fail you, Chieftain.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor’s tone hardens.

"Minax is a poison upon the land. Her shadows worm through root and blood alike. We do not fear her—we endure, we fight, and if need be, we burn the forest to save it. But even I cannot win this war alone."

Option.text: How can I help you resist her?
Have you seen her cultists here?
It sounds hopeless.
I wish you luck in your fight.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Her cultists hide among travelers, selling poison or whispering lies. If you root one out, bring me proof—an obsidian talisman or a page of her black scripture. The spirits will favor you."

Option.text: I will seek out her servants.
I will hunt another threat.
This is not my calling.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Trust is earned with blood and courage. Return when you have dealt with her shadows."

Option.text: I understand.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor’s eyes flash.

"Hope is what we make in the ashes. If you have none, seek another tribe."

Option.text: You are right. I will try.
Perhaps another day.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor shifts his weight, eyes scanning the horizon before speaking.

"Before I was chieftain, I was Kaelor of the Ash-Walkers—named for the trail of smoke my warband left in the jungles of the Southlands. We fought to protect this soil when even Britannia forgot it existed.

But war is not just blood and fire. It is memory. It is what you pass on when the fire fades."

Option.text: Why do they call you Ash-Walker?
What made you choose leadership?
Do you have family?
This land must mean much to you.
Thank you for sharing your story.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Because I walked the battlefield after every raid, barefoot, into the ashes of our fallen. I burned the dead with my own hands. I remembered every face—friend and foe. It was the only way I could sleep."

He looks at you now, voice quieter.
"Would you do the same?"

Option.text: Yes. I honor the fallen.
No. That sounds like weakness.
I don’t know. I’ve never seen real war.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor nods solemnly.
"Then you have the heart of a Verdant warrior. Fire may cleanse, but it is memory that builds the next shelter."

Option.text: Tell me more of your tribe.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His voice hardens.
"War is not a place for pride. If you cannot mourn your enemy, you will never understand yourself."

Option.text: Maybe I was wrong.
I stand by my words.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Then perhaps you will learn. Walk with us long enough, and the forest teaches even the hardest stone to soften in the rain."

Option.text: And what has the forest taught you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"That strength without purpose is a blade without a handle. I never sought to lead—but when the old chief fell to Minax’s curse, the spirits chose me.

And I said yes, not because I was ready, but because my people could not wait."

Option.text: The spirits chose well.
You sound reluctant.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"You have wisdom beyond your tribe. Thank you."

He places a hand on your shoulder briefly—an uncommon gesture from the chieftain.

Option.text: What burdens do you carry now?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"No leader begins ready. Only the arrogant think otherwise. But each season, each battle, each birth... they teach you what readiness is."

He glances toward the central bonfire.
"And what sacrifice it demands."

Option.text: Do you miss a simpler life?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaelor's voice drops.
"I had a daughter. Her name was Myari. She followed me into the wilds when she was barely ten, bow in hand. She was fearless."

He pauses, then:
"She was taken by the jungle—twisted by Minax’s rot. Now I see her face in every battle, wondering if I could’ve done more."

Option.text: I am sorry for your loss.
She died a warrior’s death.
Perhaps she was weak.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Kindness is rare, these days. Thank you. May your words shield you when blades cannot."

Option.text: Tell me what drives you now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Yes... she did. She fought even as the poison claimed her."

His gaze sharpens.
"Honor and sorrow are twins. Never forget that."

Option.text: Tell me what drives you now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His voice becomes a growl.
"Say that again, and I’ll show you how warriors die."

Kaelor turns away, refusing to speak further.

Option.text: … I apologize.
As you wish, chieftain.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"This land—its roots, its wind, its silence—is all I have left. I will die before I let Minax or Hinokami take it from us."

His jaw tightens.
"But if warriors like you still walk the paths between trees, perhaps it is not lost yet."

Option.text: You can count on me.
Your faith is misplaced.
I need time to reflect.
